College elections 2013: results

23/11/2013

All the results for this year's student association and JCRC elections

Image by

By undefined undefined

  • Alcuin
  • Derwent
  • Goodricke
  • Halifax
  • James
  • Langwith
  • Vanbrugh

Alcuin

Hustings Lewis Ratto was announced as the new Alcuin Chair at the Winter ball on Friday night. Ratto won against four other candidates; Bronwyn O'Neill, Harry Ashcroft, Peter Gaffney and Caitlin Bloor. Chair Lewis Ratto Vice-Chairperson for Entertainment and Communication James Burroughs Treasurer Harriet Bilsby Female Welfare Officer Kymrun Dhami Male Welfare Officer Alistair Bochel and Josef Crowther LGBTQ Welfare Officer Dom Smithies and Tess Pullen Disability Welfare Officer Helen Cox Campaigns Officer Anna Schmidl and Sofia Sharifah Creative Marketing Officer Tasha McNaught Social Media Officer Joanna Ma and Dean Bennell Social Officer Anna Marsh and Michael Rowan Merchandise Officer Stephanie Fuller Lois Scarth Lucy Goodyear Sports Officer Grace Clarke Melissa Turner Joanne Sharpe James Beswick Environment and Ethics Officer Freya Squires IT Officer Chirag Vadhia RAG Officer Rennie Akoni International Students' Officer Chiara Pastore Natalia Bakhir Ordinary Officer Lewi Jinks

Derwent

Hustings Ben Leatham was elected Derwent JCRC chair after a closely contested race and some controversy over announcements. Due to how many candidates ran for the position, the voting was split into two rounds, with the first round eliminating two contestants. R.O.N was the first to leave the runnings, with only 9 votes asking to reopen nominations. Sam Hickford then came fourth with just 19 votes. Next Sodha, the outgoing chair, announced the number of votes for Alastair Walker, 121 and Ben Leatham, 167. This left James Fraser celebrating with the roaring crowd, who all thought that he had won as his name was last to be called. However this turned out to be Anmoli Sodha's way of announcing the first round voting only. This actually saw James Fraser with a total of 89 votes, leaving him knocked out in the first round and ultimately not winning chair. Although slightly overshadowed by the loaded announcement of the first round, the winning vote was impressive, as Ben Leatham received a huge 198 votes, beating Alastair Walker by over 80 votes. Leatham congratulated the other candidates' campaigns and welcomed the rest of his team. He went on to wish for a successful year, keeping Derwent the best college on campus. The crowd seemed to be in great support for Leatham, although many were outraged at the treatment of Fraser. Other close contests were Vice-Chairperson Ents with winning candidates Patrick Amoroso and Andy Bostock beating Laurence Walsh and Katie Redgrave by around 40 votes. The straight Ents Representatives also had quite a narrow victory. Callum McClafferty, Dakota Glasgow-Simmonds, Ellie Budden and Lizzie Davies won against the all girl team, Annabel de Grouchy, Isabel Hawkins, Tamaki Laycock and Kitty Lovegrove by a tiny 22 votes. Volunteering Representatives saw second years Alexandra Hackitt-Anwyl and Caterina Soave beat first years Nowrin Hossain and Selina Pope. RAG Representatives also saw second years beat first years with Laura Freedman and Aimee Hardy winning by just over 10 votes. Merchandise saw Paddy Reilly O'Donnell and Rob Brogan beat Hugo Thompson and Jonathan Barrow by an impressive 62 votes as Katie Gordon and Harriet Elton went out in the first round. All uncontested positions saw the candidates winning a place on the JCRC with few R.O.N votes. This saw Derwent's first Disability Rep elected, Joseph Williams, as well as their first Welfare Representatives Tom Clark and Ely Villanueva Iglesias. Chair Ben Leatham Vice-Chairperson Ents Patrick Amoroso and Andy Bostock Vice-Chairperson Welfare Chessie Stephenson Treasurer Charles Wain Secretary Lucy Winship and Andrea Bustamante LGBT Welfare Representative Euphemia Swanson Sports Representatives Anna Cook, Beth Freane, Sam Weighall and Alex Lee Ents Representatives Callum McClafferty, Dakota Glasgow-Simmonds, Ellie Budden and Lizzie Davies Bar Representatives Felix Aylett, Kit Lockey, Anna Newsum and Rosalie Dowding Disability Rep Joseph Williams Merchandise Representative Rob Brogan and Paddy Reilly O'Donnell RAG Representative Laura Freedman and Aimee Hardy Volunteering Representatives Alexandra Hackitt-Anwyl and Caterina Soave Sponsership Representative Nick Wright and Ben Coulburn International Representative Ellen Visnes and Ioan Nedelcu Welfare Representative Tom Clark and Ely Villanueva Iglesias Press and Publicity Barto Joly de Lotbiniere Alumni Representative Maisie Kelly

Goodricke

Hustings Tara Annison was elected Goodricke Chair after a close contest. In the first round Conor Bennett was eliminated, leaving Mitchell Salter who lost to Annison by 22 votes. Scott Dawson was elected as Vice-Chair for Welfare beating Evie Cameron by 61 votes. Saul Rennison and Daniel Norris competed for Vice-Chair for Services, with neither competitor receiving enough votes to win outright. When second votes were taken into account Saul Rennison came out on top, narrowly ahead of Norris by four votes. Hannah Quigley was elected as Treasurer with 141 votes beating Harry Jeffs and Sebastian Kwon. Hugh Oats was uncontested and was elected as Secretary with 190 votes. Other close contests included the elections for Ents Officer where, in round three after third preference votes were added, Aidan Swietochowski, Benedict Townsend and James Sharp were all elected. Chairperson Tara Annison Vice Chairperson for Democracy and Welfare Scott Dawson Vice Chairperson for Services Saul Rennison Secretary Hugh Oatts Treasurer Hannah Quigley Male Welfare Officer Harry Barber Female Welfare Officer Anthea Demetriou Campaigns Officer Francessca Page Entertainments Officer Aidan Swietochowski Benedict Townsend James Sharp Bar(less) Officer(s) (2) Lauren Clarke and Zoe Woodgate Sports Officer(s) (4) Lucy Shiplee and Megan Gonsalves Lauren Mitchell Merchandise Officer(s) (2) Roisin Edwards and Jecentha Shunmugam Social Officer(s) (2) Lauren Oliver-Walsh & Hannah McCready Environment and Ethics Officer(s) (2) Toby Jones RAG Officer(s) (4) Shaunna Edwards Volunteering Officer(s) (4) Astha Saxena Shaunna Edwards Technical Officer(s) (4) Amar Rana-Deshmukh Creative Marketing (2) Luke Sheard LGBT Officer(s) (2) Sam Stockbridge The International Officer(s) (2) Gabriella Demetriou Disabilities Officer(s) (2) Callum Dziedzic Kenneth Dixon Court Representative(s) (2) Jade Kettle Boulevard Representatives(s) (2) Jessica East

Halifax

Hustings Loussin Pilikian, running unopposed, has been named Halifax President, gaining 117 votes. Several positions have been left vacant however, with the roles of Treasurer, Male Welfare Officer and RAG Officer left uncontested. President Loussin Pilikian Vice-President for Services Ella Jarvest Vice-President for Welfare Jessica Smith Vice-President for Activities Rachael Wonnacott Secretary Jake Strong Female Welfare Officer Jessica Kemp Second and Third Year Liaison Officer Rebecca Smith and Ben Rumsey Access Officer James Tracey and Josh Salisbury LGBT Officer Maria Viejo Romero Ents Officers Georgina Pugh Kieran Mullan Mike Wallbank Annie Sherratt St. Lawrence Rep Shaquile Noor Younger & Ingram Rep Brianna Kilpatrick Sponsorship Officer Rachel Smith Press & Publicity Officer Shreya Rughani Christine Saunders Volunteering Officers Ryan Westwall Tilly Heydon Ordinary Officers Sarah Roughton Jenny Bunga International Officer Boda Zhao Female Sports Officer Charlotte Pattison Hudd Technical Equipment Officer Alistair Bailey

James

Hustings Gareth Dybiec, a first year, has been elected as James JCRC Chair. This is now the second year in a row that the position of Chair has been uncontested within the college, and with 12 places still left to fill on the Committee some concern has been risen. However Dybiec seems unfazed, promising to fill the positions soon. Welfare Vice-Chair Christina Sztolin had a strong win over rival Ellie Lomas, promising to bring her previous experience to the role. Other contested positions also saw notable results with Rebecca Arnaud and Callum Hall winning the highly contested role of Welfare Officers. Chair Gareth Dybiec Vice-Chair Events Amy Baker Vice-Chair Activities Chris Warren Vice-Chair Welfare Christina Sztolin Secretary Emily Hudson Events Mary Welford, Lauren Atkins, Rosie May Bird Smith and Kieran Edge Welfare Rebecca Arnaud and Callum Hall Disability Montana Davies-Shuck

Langwith

Hustings Symone Thompson has been elected Langwith President with 147 votes. Thompson stressed again her want to improve Heslington East campus, looking forward to the new health centre and corner shop as well as implementing a new 'Langwith Day' as her flagship event. The new President also promised to help the college's many off campus students, including them in more events and providing care for those freshers who did not manage to get a room in the college itself. Miriam Keck gained the position of Deputy-President for Student Support and Community with 137 votes, after her impressive elections hustings. Here she promised to repeat the popular events of the year including 'Take Me Out', which received a huge attendance. The elections, like the hustings, proved very popular with the students, showing great college spirit despite its relative isolation. President Symone Thompson Deputy-President for Student Support and Community Miriam Keck Ents Vice-President Sean Gater Activities Vice-President Charlotte Liddell Secretary Tim Monk Treasurer Anthony Chui Male Student Support and Wellbeing Officer Edidiong Adegbola Female Student Support and Wellbeing Officer Nicola Forest Campaigns officers Alex Byron Sports Officers Millie Reed, Ruby Callister, Jack Parsonson and Tom Benney International Officer Margaux Codsi LGBT Officer Hiten Kataria Disability and Access Officer Calum Stewart Off-campus Officers Daniel Golton and Ben Gedge Volunteering Officers Jess Roberts and Alex Costanzo RAG Officers Alice Thackery and Jen Garry Merchandise Officers Alex Killeen Event co-ordinators Jolyon Brown, Oliver Henn and Kailie Cutler Global Action Officer Natthani (Cat) Santini Sponsorship Officers Rob Tailford and Tom Pickersgill Phillip Brockbank Court Rep Lara Demirci Gordon and Francesca Horsfield Court Rep Bradley Chalker

Vanbrugh

Hustings The Vanbrugh JCRC results were announced in the JCR, with candidates and interested onlookers squashed onto sofas and well-supplied by adjacent V-Bar. For the new Executive positions, the exact votes were revealed alongside the winners. The Secretary, Welfare and Communications Vice-Chairs were all uncontested, and won by Sabrina Carroll, Rachel Bates and Curtis Hodgson respectively. The position of Treasurer was won comfortably by Jessica Keir with a margin of 141 votes. Entertainment and Services Vice-Chair was the closest-run race, with Chris Morris triumphing over Benjamin Turner by only 6 votes. Before announcing the new Vanbrugh Chair, Treacey took a moment to explain the legacy of the Vanbrugh Chair Trumpet, a small brooch handed down from Chair to Chair for "about the last five years", which would be bestowed on the winner. As Luke Flinders had dropped out of the vote, four candidates were contesting the position. Victoria Bettney gained 17 votes, while Emily Watson won 82. Second place with 125 votes was George Lane, but current Eric Milner D Representative Michael Duncan won convincingly, with 189 votes. He bowed to peer pressure and gave a short speech, saying "let's make it a really good year for Vanbrugh!" to a round of applause. Treacey also took the opportunity to reflect on his committee's progress. "We've achieved an awful lot," he said, before thanking his team and congratulating all of the new JCRC members. Chair Michael Duncan Welfare Vice Chair Rachel Bates Entertainment and Service Vice Chair Chris Morris Communications Vice Chair Curtis Hodgson Treasurer Jessica Keir Secretary Sabrina Carroll Female Welfare Representative Georgina Russell Male Welfare Representative Beni Ngwamah LGBTQ Welfare Representative Mollie Staples Overseas Welfare Representative No candidates Disability and Access Welfare Representative Naomi Barrow Entertainments Representatives Jemima Wakelin Kate Clover Chloe Morrison Bar/Music Representatives Paul Scarlett Sarah Stanley RAG Representative(s) No candidates Environment and Ethics Representative Casey Murphy Merchandise Representatives Olivia Tadman Lauren Ielden Sponsorship Representative Jordan Perkins Male Sports Representative No candidates Female Sports Representative Charlotte Brown Careers & Volunteering Representative Ryanna Coleman Ordinary Member Amelia Beach Barbara Scott/Donald Barron Representative Ben Stuart Eric Milner-White Court Representative Alice Strawbridge Fairfax House/Off campus Representatives David Waters and Abigail Creak
